full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement

#### Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP)

**Contract Title:** One (1) A.6 Programmer/Software Developer, Level 2
**Contract Reference Number:** cb-17-14223032
**Contract Solicitation Number:** W6369-24-X032
**Contract Category:** SRV (Computer Services)

**Background**: The Department of National Defence (DND) requires a non-recurring service to support communications electronic countermeasures (ECM) activities. This requirement is for one (1) Intermediate Programmer/Software Developer, Level 2, to be hired on a contract basis.

**Scope of Work**: The contractor will provide intermediate programming and software development services to support ECM activities. The scope of work includes, but is not limited to:

* Design, development, testing, and deployment of software applications
* Maintenance and support of existing software systems
* Collaborating with team members to complete project tasks
* Ensuring compliance with project timelines and deliverables

**Security Requirements**: The contractor must possess a minimum security clearance of Secret.

**Trade Agreements**: This contract is subject to the following trade agreements: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

**Contract Period**: The contract will be for one (1) year, with two (2) one-year option periods.

**Closing Date**: The tender will close on 2024-06-18T14:00:00.

**Eligibility**: This tender is open to all Supply Arrangement (SA) Holders who have been pre-qualified for this requirement.

**Contact Information**: For any inquiries regarding this tender, please contact Djamel Djouaher at DJAMEL.DJOUAHER@forces.gc.ca or (613) 408-8346.

**Document Availability**: The solicitation document is available on the CanadaBuys website. Bidders are advised that CanadaBuys is not responsible for the distribution of solicitation documents. The contracting authority will conduct a selective tendering process, and bidders are expected to submit a proposal in response to this solicitation. The proposal should clearly outline the bidder's qualifications, methodology, and pricing for the work outlined in this solicitation. The successful bidder will be awarded the contract based on their combined rating of technical merit and price. The contract will be awarded on a best value basis. Please refer to
